Can we get Latino communities out to vote?

32 million Latinos will be eligible to vote in 2020. They are expected for the first time to be the nation‚Äôs largest racial or ethnic minority in a U.S. presidential election as they will account for 13.3% of all eligible voters. The Latino vote could now, more than ever, be a decisive force in the future of the country.

Voto 2020 is a documentary project profiling distinct voices in the Latino community and their work and passion to empower other Latinos to become politically active and vote. Because they rank at the top of the list in terms of Latino eligible voters, we‚Äôll look at stories in Texas, Florida, and Arizona on the local level. Each of these films highlight people who, driven by an issue important to them, are making a difference in their community.

About the Project

This series was made possible with a grant from Houston In Action.
